newsitem.title: USA: Tropical storm Marco steady south of Jamaica.
newsitem.headline: Tropical storm Marco steady south of Jamaica.

text.p: Tropical Storm Marco was stalled in the Caribbean south of Jamaica on Friday but the outer fringes of its rainbands spread over the island of Hispaniola.
At 10 a.m. EST (1500 GMT), the centre of Marco was located at latitude 15.9 north, longitude 75.5 west, about 160 miles (260 km) south-southeast of Kingston, Jamaica.
Maximum sustained winds were near 65 mph (100 kph) and some fluctuation in intensity was expected during the next 24 hours, forecasters said.
The storm had been virtually stationary during the past few hours and forecasters said they expected little motion through Saturday.
Marco's heaviest rains remained over open waters but as rain moved over Hispaniola, the storm could produce dangerous flash floods and mudslides, forecasters said.
